com.percussion.services.catalog
Interface IPSCataloger

All Known Subinterfaces:
IPSAssemblyService, IPSFilterService, IPSPublisherService, IPSSiteManager, IPSSiteManagerInternal
public interface IPSCataloger

A cataloger enumerates types and allows queries for data. Each type is a kind of object the particular service can handle. Each enumeration provides a full list of identifiers for that kind of object.

The cataloger can be used in multiple contexts. It is primarily intended as an interface to aid MSM in deploying objects to and from Rhythmyx installations, but could also be used by import or export applications.

Author:
dougrand

Method Summary
 List<IPSCatalogSummary> getSummaries(PSTypeEnum type)

Method Detail

getTypes

PSTypeEnum[] getTypes()
A given service handles one or more system types. Only one service should handle any specific type. This method returns an array of these types, which can be used by the deployment system to decide what service handles each type, especially for import.

Returns:
an array of types, never null

getSummaries

List<IPSCatalogSummary> getSummaries(PSTypeEnum type)
                                     throws PSCatalogException
For a given type, query what the known objects are. This can be used in exporting data or by the deployment system to obtain a list of known data prior to export.

Parameters:
type - the specific type in question, never null
Returns:
a list of summaries for items of the given type, never null but may be empty if the given implementation does not know about the specified type, or the set of items of that type is empty
Throws:
PSCatalogException - if there is a problem while loading the summary data

loadByType

void loadByType(PSTypeEnum type,
                String item)
                throws PSCatalogException
Load the item specified by the given document and store into persistent storage. This may overwrite an object in the persistent store.

Parameters:
type - the type for the incoming item, never null
item - the XML document as a string representing the item in question, never null or empty
Throws:
PSCatalogException - if there's an error when saving the item to the repository, or the id type isn't handled by the service

saveByType

String saveByType(IPSGuid id)
                  throws PSCatalogException
Save the item specified by the guid into an XML string. The type is taken from the passed guid. The item in question is retrieved from persistent storage as required.

Parameters:
id - the id of the item in question, never null
Returns:
the XML document string representing the item, never null or empty
Throws:
PSCatalogException - if there's an error when loading the item from the repository, or the id type isn't handled by the service
